Articles.Content:
Strake basically is a very short wing no? you don't use pWings?

DRC MM configs I can promise. Strakes are lower priority, I'm inclined to stick with pWings for all the lifting surface requirements.

Yeah pretty much. I have pWing installed but I don't use it often; I find it a bit weird.

I remember only seeing one mod ages ago with a strake part so I thought I'd suggest it. pWing is probably a superior solution though.
SPP/Stock has a few Strake parts.
those arent real strakes though or theyre way too big to be proper strakes

try these for strakes; Untested, better with pWings. without pWings they might be too big. should work with or without FAR|NEAR. but again. untested.

place the configs in RetroFuture/Aero/pWings/

http://www./download/yb7ik1289ibhea1/rFpStrakes.zip
is this compatible for x64 KSP?

is this compatible for x64 KSP?

you can try it on x64, you might get lucky and it works well. or it might not. You are on your own running x64 though.
when i try loading it the loading Kerbol system thing spins SUPER fast and does not stop

so it got past the yellow loading bar part? I guess that's better than nothing. I really have no idea. I haven't installed the x64 KSP build. The aerospikes should work in x64, they only use stock modules. can't say about much of the rest since they rely on Firespitter a good deal.

nil, I found out what I was doing wrong, The missiles drop off in the order that you place them so if you place them at the top of the drop line they will drop first. So I changed how I place em and put them bottom to top and the all released fine in my test craft Will see if they still release in order when i rebuild my huge missile bomber ship.

view from the cockpit?http://i.imgur.com/Hdr8R66.jpg

you mean IVA? that's in progress. almost through with all the props. after that it's configuring the MFDs.

I have a request suggestion for a new part: Radially-attachable aerodynamic fuel tanks. Think teardrop-shaped, or whatever would suit the rest of the parts - But low-profile, structural-looking bubbles.. If you know what I mean.

Edit: Like a fuel drop-tank cut in half lengthways stuck on the side.

Edited November 3, 2014 by SmiteZero

you mean IVA? that's in progress. almost through with all the props. after that it's configuring the MFDs.

Thank's.

You planned biggest fuselage plane? For example Antonov-12, Antonov-22 or Lockheed C-130?

IVA progress

@SmiteZero

yes, that will get in there at some point once I figure out the best way to consolidate the sizes

@RussianIvan

not sure if I'll simply scale up the 2m sections to 3m or do a new set of larger fuselage bits. probably latter.
Only a single Kerbal? Weird, it seems like two should fit just fine side by side.

Only a single Kerbal? Weird, it seems like two should fit just fine side by side.

that's the x31 cockpit. the other one will get same props and MFDs
Ah, right, now I noticed.

nli2work: Just grabbed this pack because I needed some textures for a personal project. I didn't realise how absolutely fantastic the modeling/texturing is in this mod. And the smart use of those textures on different models to save memory - very nice. It should be a model for other modders to follow imo.

Sorry to bother you, but i ran into a problem with your cargo plane parts.

The problem being, is the tail door doesn't have the same height clearance as the other parts, and it's been leading to certain.... problems:

The rover in the above picture can fit inside the actual cargo bay, just not fall out the back, because of the lower part at the top of the tail door.
Can build ME 262. Best mod ever

Sorry to bother you, but i ran into a problem with your cargo plane parts.

The problem being, is the tail door doesn't have the same height clearance as the other parts, and it's been leading to certain.... problems:

http://i.imgur.com/jc38koM.png

The rover in the above picture can fit inside the actual cargo bay, just not fall out the back, because of the lower part at the top of the tail door.

the opening is angled down. unconventional egress is expected to be problematic

That's fair enough. Nobody expects anyone to try to go Russia on dropping armor into areas. XD

(The problem actually had nothing to do with the ramp, a slightly misplaced wheel got stuck on something, causing the problem)
